item.title: 'Torres-like' Ekitike haunts long-term admirers Newcastle
item.description: Newcastle United needed no reminding of Hugo Ekitike's quality after trying to sign him last summer - and the Liverpool striker haunted his former suitors at Anfield on Saturday.

item.title: Genius or obvious? Rosenior's subs inspire Chelsea comeback win
item.description: After Chelsea's first comeback win from two goals down in a Premier League match, were Liam Rosenior's substitutions against West Ham genius or obvious?

item.title: England midfielder Gomes set for Wolves loan
item.description: Wolves are set to complete a loan move for Marseille's England midfielder Angel Gomes.

item.title: The most powerful woman in football - meet game's first female super agent
item.description: Super agent Rafaela Pimenta looks after some of the biggest names in the game. She has been speaking exclusively to the BBC

item.title: The Basque derby - the friendliest rivalry in world football?
item.description: With a sense of shared identity and fans mixing in the stands, is the Basque derby between Athletic Club and Real Sociedad the friendliest in the world?

item.title: Liverpool in talks over Sunderland loanee Geertruida
item.description: Liverpool are in talks to sign Dutch defender Lutsharel Geertruida on loan.

item.title: All you need to know as Arsenal face Corinthians in Champions Cup final
item.description: History is guaranteed at Emirates Stadium on Sunday as Arsenal host Brazil's Corinthians in the first-ever Women's Champions Cup final.

item.title: 'A great headache' - can Madueke stake claim for Arsenal and England?
item.description: The sight of Noni Madueke flying past defenders and putting dangerous crosses into the penalty will have been a welcome sight for Mikel Arteta.

item.title: Moyes defiant after being booked for celebration
item.description: Everton manager David Moyes criticises the laws of the game after being booked for sprinting onto the pitch to celebrate Beto's last-gasp equaliser at Brighton.

item.title: Carrick backs Man Utd fan support before new protest
item.description: Manchester United head coach Michael Carrick praises the club's supporters for their backing before planned protest against the ownership.

item.title: Ekitike double helps Liverpool cruise past Newcastle
item.description: Summer signing Huge Ekitike scores twice as Liverpool record their first league win of 2026, putting four goals past Newcastle United.

item.title: Chelsea fight back to beat West Ham in dramatic derby
item.description: Chelsea come back from being two goals down at half-time to beat West Ham in stoppage time.

item.title: Arsenal score four in superb win against Leeds
item.description: Arsenal get their title charge back on track with a dominant display against Leeds, their first win in four Premier League games.

item.title: Kroupi scores stunner as Bournemouth beat Wolves
item.description: 19-year-old Eli Juniour Kroupi scores his eight Premier League goal of the season to help Bournemouth beat Wolves 2-0.

item.title: Everton's Beto nets stoppage-time leveller at Brighton
item.description: Beto celebrates his birthday by scoring in stoppage time for Everton to salvage a point in a hard-fought draw against Brighton.

item.title: Likened to Mbappe - teenager Kroupi flourishing at Bournemouth
item.description: Eli Junior Kroupi's stunning goal for Bournemouth against Wolves will help soften the blow of losing Antoine Semenyo to Manchester City.

item.title: 'Hollywood welcome' - inside a Wrexham transfer window
item.description: With the potential for deadline day deals, BBC Sport looks at how Wrexham's recruitment works under the ownership of Ryan Reynolds and Rob Mac

item.title: Mateta agrees AC Milan move - Sunday's gossip
item.description: Crystal Palace striker Jean-Philippe Mateta agrees a contract with AC Milan, Fulham have a £20m offer for Joe Willock rejected by Newcastle, plus more.

item.title: Test for Lampard and Hackney driving Boro - Aaron McLean's EFL Takeaways
item.description: Final Score EFL pundit Aaron McLean reflects on the highs and lows after Saturday's action.

item.title: Klopp urged me to take Man City assistant job - Lijnders
item.description: Pep Lijnders says former Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp urged him to take the job as Pep Guardiola's assistant coach at Manchester City.

item.title: How West Ham collapse at Chelsea led to mass brawl
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Shay Given breaks down how West Ham's frustration in their loss against Chelsea, after being two goals ahead, led to an on the pitch scuffle and Jean-Clair Todibo seeing red.

item.title: How Ekitike is becoming Liverpool's star man
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Steph Houghton and Shay Given discuss how Hugo Ekitike has become Liverpool's star striker, as his chemistry with summer signing Florian Wirtz has emerged.

item.title: 'Spurs want to stick with Frank but may have no choice'
item.description: The Football Focus team preview the game between Spurs and Man City, debating whether Spurs boss Thomas Frank will be able to navigate this challenging period.

item.title: What can be done to disrupt Arsenal's identical set-pieces?
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Shay Given analyses how Arsenal take their set-pieces each week and what other teams need to do to disrupt their consistency.

item.title: 'Someone will cry' - do clubs hold the power in the transfer market?
item.description: Football agent Rafaela Pimenta says the transfer system needs to change as clubs have too much power and are treating their players as "assets in a business", not as "humans".

item.title: Sutton's predictions v boxer Francesca Hennessy
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on boxer Francesca Hennessy and AI with his predictions for this week's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Nine siblings and a dog called Zoomer - Wirtz in his own words
item.description: Florian Wirtz sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about his slow start at Anfield, playing padel and making Bundesliga history.

item.title: Why Motherwell's Maswanhise is Scotland's hottest property
item.description: BBC Scotland looks at the rise of Motherwell's Tawanda Maswanhise this season.

item.title: 'I want us to catch fire' - McCann hopes for Kilmarnock turning point
item.description: Neil McCann eyes a resurgent run for Kilmarnock after easing by Aberdeen.

item.title: Pick your combined Man City-Chelsea XI
item.description: Women's Super League top Manchester City and Chelsea face each other on Sunday. Who makes your best XI from the two teams?

item.title: Forest agree Ortega deal and target Inter's Frattesi
item.description: Nottingham Forest agree a deal for Manchester City goalkeeper Stefan Ortega worth up to £500,000.

item.title: Former FA chairman Lord Triesman dies
item.description: He joined Tony Blair's government in 2004, holding prominent roles in politics until his death.

item.title: Holloway slams 'unprofessional' Clarke ban
item.description: Swindon Town boss Ian Holloway criticises FA officials as captain Ollie Clarke is banned 24 hours before Saturday's League Two meeting with Barrow.

item.title: 'The fans love him' - Slot praises Ekitike performance
item.description: Liverpool manager Arne Slot speaks on the fans love for star striker Hugo Ekitike, and his developing relationship with Florian Wirtz, in reaction to their win against Newcastle in the Premier League.

item.title: Rosenior hails 'world class' Fernandez in Chelsea comeback
item.description: Liam Rosenior is full of praise for Chelsea's second-half comeback win against West Ham, singling out matchwinner Enzo Fernandez's performance.

item.title: Iraola hails 'incredible' goalscoring teenager Kroupi
item.description: Bournemouth manager Andoni Iraola credits much of his side's recent improvment to "incredible" performances of Eli Junior Kroupi, as well as the depth brought in by new signings.

item.title: Arsenal showed character and quality in win at Leeds - Arteta
item.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says he is pleased with the dominance, character and quality that his side showed in their 4-0 win over Leeds.

item.title: 'I've not got a crystal ball' - Edwards coy on Strand Larsen future
item.description: Wolves manager Rob Edwards says that recruitment for his side has been difficult in January, whilst adding he is unsure about the future of striker Jorgen Strand Larsen.

item.title: What's meant for you won't pass you by - Calvert-Lewin
item.description: Dominic Calvert-Lewin discusses the loneliness he experienced while waiting for a transfer this summer and how his form since joining Leeds has re-ignited his England hopes.

item.title: 'Celtic coach phoned to say sorry for behaviour'
item.description: Heart of Midlothian manager Derek McInnes says Celtic assistant coach Mark Fotheringham called him to apologise for his behaviour at Tynecastle last weekend.

item.title: A 10-point lead cut to three - is it just a blip for Coventry?
item.description: With their Championship lead down to three points how worried should Coventry City fans be about a potential promotion meltdown?

item.title: How do Liverpool fix their struggles against low blocks?
item.description: Why are Liverpool struggling against low blocks in the Premier League, how are they trying to unlock them and what could they do better?

item.title: Journalist dreams & Keane reunion? How O'Neill continues to revive Celtic
item.description: Showman Martin O'Neill continues to thrive as Celtic's interim manager as he guides the club through to the Europa League play-off round.

item.title: Who is 'shy and nervous' Villa match-winner Jimoh-Aloba?
item.description: Aston Villa match-winner Jamaldeen Jimoh-Aloba is described as "shy and nervous" by Morgan Rogers - but the teenager announced himself on the European stage.

item.title: Transfers - January 2026
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: How much do teams earn for reaching Champions League knockouts?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team breaks down how much money Premier League teams have received by advancing to the knockout phase of the competition.

item.title: Why do Premier League teams spend less in January?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at why clubs spend significantly more on new signings in the summer than they do in the January transfer window.

item.title: Which countries haven't had a Premier League player?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore which countries have not been represented in the Premier League.

item.title: Which countries are set to win extra Champions League places?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains which countries are on course to win extra qualification spots for the 2026-27 Champions League campaign.

item.title: What is it like to be a caretaker manager?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what life is like as a caretaker boss after Michael Carrick's appointment at Manchester United, with Neil Warnock and Phil Brown detailing their experiences.

item.title: Who is Manchester City debutant Max Alleyne?
item.description: Manchester City defender Max Alleyne will make his Premier League debut on Wednesday after being named in Pep Guardiola's team to face Brighton.

item.title: What is the Women's Champions Cup and who do Arsenal play in final?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at Fifa's new Women's Champions Cup.

item.title: Celtic in chase for forward Adamu - gossip
item.description: Celtic move for Austria forward as Aberdeen line up German midfielder and Hibs bid for Croatian winger...

item.title: Why La Liga title race is back on
item.description: A slip from Barcelona and a resurgent Real Madrid means the title race is back on in La Liga.

item.title: Who can join Aston Villa in Europa League last 16?
item.description: Aston Villa are through to the Europa League last 16 already - but with one round of matches to play in the league phase, only two of the other three British sides have a chance of joining them.

item.title: Rado Vidosic was 'one of the most incredible men'
item.description: Brighton interim manager Chris Roberts described Rado Vidosic as "one of the most incredible men" he has ever met, following the death of the club's head of women's coaching.

item.title: Arsenal in talks to sign Barcelona's Batlle in summer
item.description: Arsenal have held advanced discussions with Barcelona full-back Ona Batlle in the hope of reaching a pre-contract agreement to sign her in the summer.

item.title: 'When something needs doing, people say to just ask Lucy'
item.description: England and Chelsea defender Lucy Bronze speaks to BBC Sport about finding more confidence with age and why chasing titles is more exciting.

item.title: Bompastor tracks back on WSL title 'gone' comments
item.description: Chelsea manager Sonia Bompastor has tracked back on her comments saying the WSL title is "probably over" by insisting her side will "never give up".

item.title: Cages, crushes and stabbings - is European away safety getting worse?
item.description: BBC Sport explores the safety issues fans face when following their team across Europe.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.
